Class LineFilters

  • java.lang.Object
    • LineFilters

  • public class LineFilters
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of static functions that are responsible to check if the line that was read in file fulfills the filter and its requirements. It also contains functions that print if the user input was correct when generating a filter.

      static void printInput(int choice)
      prints a message to the user to either enter or renter a input that was incorrect

      • distFrom

        public static boolean distFrom(double lat1,
                               double lng1,
                               double lat2,
                               double lng2,
                               double radius)
        Parameters:
        lat1 - the latitude from the file
        lng1 - the longitude from the file
        lat2 - the latitude from the user
        lng2 - the longitude from the file
        radius - the user given radius
        Returns:
        true if the given WIFI point is in the filters radius

      • isDateInBounds

        public static boolean isDateInBounds(java.util.Date startDate,
                                     java.util.Date endDate,
                                     long inputDate)
        Parameters:
        startDate - is from the users date
        endDate - is from the users date
        inputDate - is from the WIFI pointsq date
        Returns:
        true if the inputDate is in bounds of the start date and end date.

      • printInput

        public static void printInput(int choice)
        prints a message to the user to either enter or renter a input that was incorrect
        Parameters:
        choice - is the choice of filter to be used
